sections.content: Pre-Discussion
Given that Zoho has another CRM in Zoho Bigin, **why do you think Zoho CRM and Bigin both exist as product offerings?**
Alternative: Use the Learn Lesson 'Zoho CRM Basics: Sales' to cover the same information.
What is CRM?

**CRM stands for Customer Relationship Management.** CRMs are used to manage and analyze customer interactions and data throughout the customer lifecycle. The goal is to improve customer service relationships and assist in customer retention, driving sales growth.

CRM can also refer to a system or tool that helps businesses manage relationships and interactions with customers and potential customers. A CRM system can help companies stay connected to customers, streamline processes, and improve profitability.
What CRM Systems Enable Businesses to Do

items: **Record and manage customer information** - CRM tools can store a wealth of customer data, including personal information, purchase history, preferences, and concerns
**Track and manage customer interactions** - CRM tools offer the ability to track every customer interaction, from calls and emails to meetings and sales

**Analyze and interpret customer data** - CRM systems can analyze customer data to reveal patterns, trends, and insights, helping businesses improve their products, services, and customer relationships
**Automate tasks** - CRM tools provide automation features that can handle repetitive tasks, freeing time for teams to focus on other business areas

sections.content: Overall, CRM is about **creating better relationships with your customers** so that you can provide them with the service, support, and experiences they need.
How Does Zoho CRM Differ from Bigin?
**Bigin** is more of a **pipeline-focused tool** and is specifically focused on making a sale. While Zoho CRM operates under this goal as well, CRM is a lot more comprehensive.
Additional Capabilities in Zoho CRM
Zoho CRM includes advanced features that Bigin doesn't offer:

items: Inventory management system
Advanced automations
Quoting and invoicing capabilities
Process management (Blueprints and Assignment Rules)
Many other enterprise-level tools

sections.content: Versatility Beyond Sales
In fact, many customers choose to set up Zoho CRM as an **ERP system**. It can be configured for various use cases beyond traditional sales:

items: **Scheduling tool** for school campuses
**Visit tracking and patient portal system** for medical entities
**Project management** for service businesses
**Custom business processes** tailored to specific industries

sections.content: When to Transition from Bigin to CRM
The transition from Bigin to Zoho CRM becomes necessary when:

items: A business **outgrows Bigin's record flow** and needs to manage more complex data
The business needs **advanced capabilities** like process management (Blueprints, Assignment Rules)
The team requires **inventory management, quoting, or invoicing** features
The business needs **deeper automation** and workflow customization
Multiple departments need to **share and collaborate** on customer data in more sophisticated ways

sections.content: Think of Bigin as your starting point for pipeline management, and Zoho CRM as the full-featured platform you grow into as your business scales.
Hands-On Activity: Converting Bigin to Zoho CRM
Now it's time to take the step of converting your Bigin account to Zoho CRM (if feasible). This process will migrate your existing data and pipelines to the more robust CRM platform.
Conversion Process Overview
During this activity, your instructor will:

items: Explain the conversion process step-by-step
Show at least one example of how Bigin converts to CRM
Demonstrate what the CRM account looks like after conversion
Discuss what happens to your pipelines, contacts, and deals

sections.content: Alternative: Starting Fresh with CRM
If conversion is not feasible for any reason, you'll start a new Zoho CRM account instead. Either way, this is just setup and preparation - you don't need to do any work in CRM yet.
Note: You'll be able to explore and learn about CRM functionality in subsequent lessons. This activity is purely for account setup and preparation.
What to Expect After Conversion
After converting from Bigin to Zoho CRM, you'll notice:

items: Your pipelines become **Deals** with stages
Contacts and Companies are organized into separate modules
Many more modules appear (Accounts, Leads, Products, Quotes, Invoices, etc.)
Additional customization options in settings
More advanced automation and workflow tools

sections.content: Don't be overwhelmed by the additional features - we'll explore each area systematically in the coming lessons. For now, just get familiar with logging in and navigating the interface.
